intro: Biscutella bourgaei, commonly known as the Sierra Madre biscutella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, basal leaves. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Biscutella bourgaei is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
